direct_answer.text: First we need to figure out how many apples Beck initially has before any transfers occur. To find this amount, subtract the difference (23) from Boris’ original count. This yields 5476985 – 23 equals 5476962 apples which represents what Beck starts off with. Next you add ten apples since Boris transferred them into Beck’s possession resulting in a new balance standing as follows; Boris(apples)=5476985-(10=5476975), Beck=(5476962+10)(which makes it equal to 5476972). Finally calculate their differences using subtraction like so :  5476972–5476975, yielding −3 lesser or simply saying 'three'.
